intro: Solanum endlicheri, commonly known as the yellow nightshade, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters tall, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae), which includes other well-known plants such as tomatoes and potatoes. Solanum endlicheri is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in some areas.
